  • Method Details

    • findUserToPreemptFor

      protected abstract Optional<T> findUserToPreemptFor (T taskOwner)

    • escalonar

      public void escalonar()
      Attempts to schedule a task and a suitable machine for one of the users, giving preference to users "first" in a sorted list according to the getUserComparator() comparison criteria} of UserProcessingControl.

      The method stops immediately upon any successful scheduling of a task in a resource, be it 'normally' or through preemption.

      For details on scheduling criteria, see:
      • Task selection
      • Machine selection
      Specified by:
      escalonar in class Policy<GridMaster>

    • escalonarRecurso

      public Processing escalonarRecurso()
      This algorithm's resource scheduling does not conform to the standard SchedulingPolicy interface.
      Therefore, calling this method on instances of this algorithm will result in an UnsupportedOperationException being thrown.
      Specified by:
      escalonarRecurso in class Policy<GridMaster>
      Returns:
      not applicable in this context, an exception is thrown instead.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - whenever called.

    • escalonarTarefa

      public GridTask escalonarTarefa()
      This algorithm's task scheduling does not conform to the standard SchedulingPolicy interface.

      Therefore, calling this method on instances of this algorithm will result in an UnsupportedOperationException being thrown.

      Specified by:
      escalonarTarefa in class SchedulingPolicy<GridMaster>
      Returns:
      not applicable in this context, an exception is thrown instead.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - whenever called.
